comments.raw_text:
Seen with FF 4.0.1 and the virtual desktop manager VirtuaWin v4.3 from http://virtuawin.sourceforge.net/ :

Middle-clicking the Firefox window bar does not open the VirtuaWin menu containing e.g. the "Move to Desktop" commands.

That's probably because Firefox 4 has a self-drawn window bar, as suggested in http://sourceforge.net/projects/virtuawin/forums/forum/257054/topic/4426396 .
comments.creator: robert.pollak@posteo.net
comments.author: robert.pollak@posteo.net
comments.text:
Seen with FF 4.0.1 and the virtual desktop manager VirtuaWin v4.3 from http://virtuawin.sourceforge.net/ :

Middle-clicking the Firefox window bar does not open the VirtuaWin menu containing e.g. the "Move to Desktop" commands.

That's probably because Firefox 4 has a self-drawn window bar, as suggested in http://sourceforge.net/projects/virtuawin/forums/forum/257054/topic/4426396 .
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 644277 ***
comments.author: jmathies@mozilla.com
comments.creator: jmathies@mozilla.com

comments.text: I think this is not a duplicate: Bug 644277 is only about the right-click menu, while this bug is about a middle-click menu.
comments.author: robert.pollak@posteo.net
comments.creator: robert.pollak@posteo.net
comments.raw_text: I think this is not a duplicate: Bug 644277 is only about the right-click menu, while this bug is about a middle-click menu.

(In reply to comment #2)
> I think this is not a duplicate: Bug 644277 is only about the right-click
> menu, while this bug is about a middle-click menu.

Hmm, ok, I can reproduce this. It works if the fx button is disabled, but when it is enabled, their hook doesn't pick up the client area middle-click. This seems more of a bug in their software vs. a fx bug. Reopening though to track. You might consider reporting this to the authors of that app.
comments.creator: jmathies@mozilla.com
comments.author: jmathies@mozilla.com
